content.user_title: Build crypto trading bots with Hummingbot
content.value_statement: Hummingbot is an open-source algorithmic trading platform for crypto markets. This skill provides comprehensive documentation for building automated trading strategies, connecting to exchanges, and integrating AI assistants for trading automation.
actual_capabilities: Provide documentation for 50+ exchange connectors (Binance, Coinbase, Hyperliquid, etc.)
Explain trading strategies including market making, arbitrage, and directional trading
Detail V2 strategy framework with Controllers and Executors for modular strategies
Document MCP (Model Context Protocol) tools for AI assistant integration
Guide users through installation, configuration, and deployment workflows
Support backtesting and performance analysis for trading strategies
limitations: Does not execute trades - provides documentation and guidance only
Requires users to have their own exchange API keys and wallet credentials
Cannot access user data or trading accounts directly
Documentation-focused - does not modify system files or install software

best_practices: Always test strategies in paper trading mode before using real funds on mainnet
Use balance limits to prevent over-exposure on any single trading pair
Monitor bot performance regularly and adjust parameters based on market conditions
Enable kill switch to automatically stop trading if losses exceed defined threshold
anti_patterns: Running multiple bots with overlapping trading pairs without rate limit coordination
Using the same API key for production and testing environments
Neglecting to set proper stop-loss or kill switch thresholds
Deploying untested strategies on mainnet without paper trading validation

faq.question: What exchanges does Hummingbot support?
faq.answer: Hummingbot supports 50+ exchange connectors including Binance, Coinbase, Hyperliquid, Kucoin, Gate.io, OKX, and many DEXs via Gateway.

faq.question: Can AI assistants control Hummingbot?
faq.answer: Yes, Hummingbot provides an MCP server that integrates with Claude, Gemini, and Codex for natural language trading bot control.

faq.question: Is Hummingbot safe for live trading?
faq.answer: Hummingbot is open-source and auditable. Always test strategies in paper mode first and use appropriate risk controls like kill switches.

faq.question: What programming skills are needed?
faq.answer: Basic scripts require Python knowledge. The V2 framework allows configuring strategies without coding using Controllers and YAML configs.

faq.question: Does Hummingbot access my exchange credentials?
faq.answer: API keys and secrets are stored locally and encrypted. Hummingbot Foundation does not have access to user credentials or funds.

faq.question: How does Hummingbot compare to other trading bots?
faq.answer: Hummingbot is open-source, community-governed, and supports both centralized and decentralized exchanges with modular strategy architecture.
